description: Clearance Level None Category Business Process Analysis Location Remote, Working from the USA Public Trust: None Requisition Type: Regular Your Impact Own your opportunity to be at the center of GDIT’s business operations. Make an impact by collaborating across functions to make mission success achievable. Job Description Deliver insights to help transform GDIT into a data driven organization as a Senior EDM Business Analyst. Your work will support an entire team to publish data products and data visualizations and dashboards that support GDIT programs. Your work will provide creative solutions to our data obstacles and help advance GDIT's mission. Here, you can make a meaningful impact on our mission and on your career. At GDIT, people are our differentiator. As a Senior EDM Business Analyst, you will help ensure today is safe and tomorrow is smarter. Our visuals and data products depend on accurate requirements from to advance our maturity in data visualization and analytics. This role will have exposure to many different business areas across GDIT and requires a person that can work with many different personalities and knowledge base. Your work will provide organized and documented requirements and sprints for our team. On the Enterprise Data Management Team, you can make a meaningful impact on our mission and on your career. HOW A SENIOR EDM BUSINESS ANALYST WILL MAKE AN IMPACT Serves as the main coordinator between EDM and development teams to create work products Creates meaningful and trusting relationships with the business by capturing their requests. Serves as the primary for requirements gathering and documentation Develop and maintains regular cadence of status meetings between EDM and development team Be the voice of EDM when engaging with business areas across GDIT Champions the use of data governance principles WHAT YOU’LL NEED TO SUCCEED: Education: Bachelor's degree or four additional years of experience in lieu of a degree Required Skills and Abilities: Must be able to translate business asks into requirements for data products and data requirements into designs for data visualizations. Ability to facilitate requirements sessions and scrum meetings with many personalities. Ability to elicit thought and responses from a remote team. Works as part of an Agile software team utilizing the Scrum framework, acting as the pivotal resource that bridges customer expectations and team output. Acts as a leadership resource as needed, providing guidance on business workflow and customer needs. Works with customers daily to define project scope and objectives. Prepares moderately complex business-technical documentation such as flow charts, models, procedures, and system specifications to be presented both internally and externally. Utilizes business expertise to provide feedback and direction for the preparation and maintenance of system user documentation. Preferred Experience: 5+ years of related experience as a Business Analyst. Preference given to candidates with experience with JIRA or Tableau. GDIT IS YOUR PLACE: Full-flex work week to own your priorities at work and at home 401K with company match Comprehensive health and wellness packages Internal mobility team dedicated to helping you own your career Professional growth opportunities including paid education and certifications Cutting-edge technology you can learn from Rest and recharge with paid vacation and holidays

description: NVIDIA has been transforming computer graphics, PC gaming, and accelerated computing for more than 25 years. Today, we’re tapping into the unlimited potential of AI to define the next era of computing. Millions of developers, data scientists, researchers, and IT professionals use our programs, SDKs, training, and online communities to help them do their life's work. We are seeking a highly organized and meticulous analyst to be a part of our Developer Business Operations team. You will be responsible for the precise execution of day-to-day operations of our global developer grant programs and using data-driven insights to streamline processes, drive collaboration and fuel informed decisions to support the Developer Marketing organizational strategies, reliability, excellence, and growth. Do you thrive in a dynamic and constantly evolving environment? Do you love collaborating with multi-functional teams and applying your program and analytical skills to bring groundbreaking technology to people around the world? If so, we can’t wait to talk to you! What you’ll be doing: Working with multi-functional stakeholders to operate NVIDIA's hardware access programs Designing and implementing solutions for program management, including grant delivery to recipients, data tracking, analysis, and reporting Interfacing directly with prospective or enrolled developers to connect them to the right resources, explain program benefits, and triage any issues they may be experiencing. Driving efficient budget tracking to ensure we’re delivering exceptional value from program investments Actively measuring key performance indicators, carefully monitoring trends, and making data-driven recommendations to improve our programs and processes Crafting documentation and flow diagrams to enable self-serve processes and program scalability Supporting general business operations including data analysis, reporting, and analytics from various data sources What we need to see: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience or higher with 3+ years of demonstrated business analyst or project management experience at a technology company or academic institution You are strategic, hands-on, and detailed with the ability to solve problems independently Proven experience using a mix of analytical, technical, and operational skills to partner with internal and external customers. Strong affinity for organization and an obsession with data integrity. Able to see the big picture while identifying and resolving areas for improvement. Consistent track record of successfully working in global, cross-functional, and remote teams to build relationships and drive tangible results Superb communication, decision-making, and influencing abilities Ways to stand out from the crowd: Familiar with CRM tools such as Salesforce and Marketo. Experience driving successful academic-industry partnerships PMP or other Project/Program Management Certification Passion for bringing the latest resources in AI, 3D, and scientific computing to new users such as students, underrepresented communities, and emerging markets With competitive salaries and a generous benefits package, NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers; we have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us and, due to unparalleled growth, our best-in-class teams are rapidly growing. The base salary range is 84,000 USD - 166,750 USD. Your base salary will be determined based on your location, experience, and the pay of employees in similar positions. You will also be eligible for equity and benefits . NVIDIA accepts applications on an ongoing basis. NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

description: Job Category: Global IT Job Family: Application Development Job Description: The IT Business Analyst works with the Operations/Production Execution business area to identify user needs, document requirements and processes and addresses improvements to accomplish business objectives. The IT Business Analyst provides expertise in identifying, evaluating and developing systems and procedures that are cost effective and meet business requirements. This position is responsible for configuring system settings and options; plans and executes system, integration and user acceptance testing. This role will aid in defining and implementing standard processes for the company while ensuring local business needs are met. This position can be 100% remote/working from home or hybrid work schedule located at our Home Office in Green Bay, Wisconsin. The hybrid work schedule is 2 days at Home Office and the remainder from home. About our Green Bay, WI Home Office: You’ll find lots to love in our beautiful home office in downtown Green Bay, Wisconsin. Our jeans-friendly environment has indoor and outdoor collaboration spaces, state-of-the-art R&D and sensory labs, culinary kitchens, a pilot plant, innovation center and more. Take advantage of outdoor workspaces. Sample and provide feedback on new products from our R&D team. Enjoy free coffee, soda and popcorn. Hit up a game of ping pong on your break. Or take a short walk to restaurants, breweries, the YMCA and a weekly farmer’s market on the scenic Fox River. You can even see Lambeau Field from our top floor. What you’ll do: Tactical Responsible for producing and delivering high quality, structured, fully tested solutions on time, and in accordance with business requirements and IT standards. Analyzes the feasibility of and may assist with the development of requirements for new systems and enhancements to existing systems; ensures the system design fits the needs of the business. Responsible for understanding system functionality and communicating system capabilities to the business.
